titlestmt.titleproper: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Houston family papers (series 19) 1693-1980 post-1930s
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Houston family papers (series 19)

bioghist.p: The Houston family came to the Lancaster County area of Pennsylvania in the early eighteenth century from Scotland, by way of Northern Ireland. The family prospered and Henry Howard Houston's grandfather, John Houston, was able to gain a college education. John also earned a medical degree while studying at the University of Pennsylvania and was active as a patriot during the American Revolution. Houston married Susanna Wright, of Wrightsville, Pennsylvania. The Wright's were also a successful and politically powerful family. Susanna's father, John Wright, owned a ferry across the Susquehanna River, and sat in the Pennsylvania Assembly. Samuel Nelson Houston (1790-1878), one of John and Susanna's nine children, was the father of Henry Howard Houston. In 1817 Samuel married Susan Strickler, and the second of five children, Henry Howard, was born October 3, 1820.

scopecontent.p: The Houston family papers contain material in a wide variety of formats including photographs; newspaper and magazine clippings, and other printed material; manuscript items including letters, notes, and lists. This series is primarily concerned with early family history and genealogy, up to and including material about Henry Howard Houston's father, Samuel N. Houston.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
